channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report X-2025020430
item.description:
Report X-2025020430

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS ON BACK WALL OF TRAILER. IT WAS THEN NOTED PACKAGE WAS WET. UNLOADERS EXITED TRAILER AND NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED RESPONDER. RESPONDER WAS ABLE TO RETRIEVE PACKAGE AND TAKE TO DMP AREA FOR PROECESSING. NO RELEASE IN TRAILER.

item.title: Report E-2025020083
item.description:
Report E-2025020083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: HARDIN
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LOVE'S TRAVEL STOPS & COUNTRY STORES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 70-gallons of diesel were released during fuel delivery due to a possible hose breakage. The release impacted the asphalt. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched Olympus Technical Services, Inc. to assist with cleanup. Olympus Technical Services, Inc. generated 2-roll offs containing impacted snow and absorbents for disposal.
